result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Andrew Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess <1,000 PerformRecording(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.208(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Andrew Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court grants expungement if fees, costs and surcharges are paid.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  

Case set for status conference. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 :

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
- Court sentences defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served and 1 day good time credit, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, and surcharges by 01/09/2017.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
- DNA has already been taken. 
- Court GRANTS expungment if fees, costs and surcharges and paid. 

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders in court with attorney Angel Johnson for Robert J Hampton with student intern Dan Larsen.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant IS eligible for Public Defender representation.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders not in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 04.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert Andrew Sanders not in court.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/18/15 @ 1:30 pm
